title: DataCite Metadata Schema v4.6 – REST API profile (bundled)
description: Self‑contained JSON Schema and JSON‑LD context for validating and semantically describing DataCite 4.6 metadata as submitted to the DataCite REST API.  This profile reflects the property names and object structures used by the API and inlines all controlled vocabularies.

identifiers.description: Additional identifiers for the resource (other than the DOI)

identifierType.description: Type of the identifier (e.g. Local accession number, ISBN, etc.).

alternateIdentifiers.description: Alternate identifiers for the resource, distinct from primary DOI and internal identifiers.

alternateIdentifierType.description: Type of the alternate identifier (e.g. ISBN, PMID).

doi.description: The DOI assigned to the resource.

creators.description: Persons or organizations responsible for creating the resource.

name.description: Full name of the creator (family name, given name) or organisation name.

affiliationIdentifier.description: Identifier for the affiliation (e.g. ROR, ISNI).

nameIdentifiers.description: Persistent identifiers for the creator (e.g. ORCID, ISNI).

lang.description: IETF BCP 47 language tag, e.g. 'en' or 'en-GB'.

publisher.description: Information about the entity that publishes the resource.

publisherIdentifier.description: Persistent identifier for the publisher (e.g., ROR, ISNI).

publisherIdentifierScheme.description: Identifier scheme for the publisher (e.g., ROR, ISNI).

lang.description: IETF BCP 47 language tag for the publisher name.

container.description: Information about the container in which the resource is published (e.g. journal, book, collection).

identifierType.description: Type of the container identifier (e.g. ISSN).

publicationYear.description: Year when the resource was or will be made publicly available (YYYY).

subjects.description: Subject keywords or classification codes describing the resource.

contributors.description: Persons or organizations that contributed to the resource in addition to the creators.

dates.description: Important dates in the life cycle of the resource.

language.description: Primary language of the resource (IETF BCP 47 code).

resourceType.description: Free‑text description of the resource type.

relatedIdentifiers.description: Relations to other identifiers such as URLs, DOIs or ISNIs.

relatedItems.description: Full citation information for resources related to this one.

formats.description: Technical formats of the resource (e.g. MIME types).

version.description: Version number or label of the resource.

rightsList.description: Rights statements or licences for the resource.

rightsUri.description: URI of the rights statement or licence.

schemeUri.description: URI of the rights identifier scheme.

lang.description: Language of the rights statement (IETF BCP 47).

descriptions.description: Free‑form text descriptions of the resource.

fundingReferences.description: Information about financial support for the resource.

responseProfile.title: DataCite REST API Response (JSON:API envelope)
responseProfile.description: Companion schema to validate DataCite REST API responses that use a JSON:API envelope. This schema validates the envelope and allows additional, read-only attributes returned by the API. Use the submit/bundled profile (this file's root schema) to validate client-submitted payloads.

attributes.description: The DataCite metadata attributes. In API responses this includes read-only and analytics fields (e.g., url, state, viewCount, downloadsOverTime, created, registered, updated, etc.). These are intentionally not constrained here to keep the response schema in sync with server-side additions.

submitProfile.title: DataCite REST API Submission (JSON:API envelope)
submitProfile.description: Schema to validate DataCite REST API submissions using a JSON:API envelope. The attributes payload MUST conform to the root attributes schema in this file.
